title: New Wave Chicken Chintan

ingredients.name: chicken backs (or two small chickens, broken down, breasts removed)

steps: Add the chicken to a stockpot, cover with water.
Bring the soup up to a boil briefly, skim any scum. Hold here for 5-10 minutes, or until scum subsides.
Reduce heat back down to below simmer (around 88°C/190°F), hold for 6 hours.
Strain the soup and hold it until needed.
notes: The new wave of shoyu ramen emerging in Tokyo is based on using only chicken and nothing else.
The method is effectively the same as other chintan applications.
Extremely minimalist - showcases pure chicken flavor.
Can be made in pressure cooker: 45 minutes at pressure (or 30 minutes with 30-minute natural release).
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
